sub_topic: Coordination chemistry of lanthanides and actinides
message_1: What is the coordination number and geometry of a molecule of cerium bromide (CeBr3) in its solid-state crystal structure?
message_2: In the solid-state crystal structure of cerium bromide (CeBr3), the coordination number of cerium (Ce) is 6, and the geometry is octahedral. This means that each cerium atom is surrounded by six bromine (Br) atoms, arranged at the vertices of an octahedron.
